intro: Piper longevillosum, commonly known as the long-stalked pepper plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Piperaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its climbing habit, with long, slender stems that can reach several meters in length. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape, with a glossy green surface and a slightly serrated margin. The small, greenish-white flowers are borne in clusters and are followed by small, round berries that turn red when mature.
